RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 49. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMELIA'S DREAM rated just off the pace in the two and three paths on the opening turn, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, took the lead approaching the five sixteenths, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert in the lane. CLOUD MOVER rounded the opening turn in the three path, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn, dug in through the stretch and just lasted in the duel for second. JUST HAVE FAITH raced well back in the three path on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and just missed in the stretch duel for second. LADY GANGSTER rated the pace inside, came under pressure and was met toward the five sixteenths pole, then faded at the rail on the far turn. SUNSET QUEEN saved ground off the pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. ODINA rated close inside, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail into the far turn. ISLE BE THERE settled back two deep on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. LOCKDOWN VANNA raced in the five path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened nearing the far turn. OK EMILY was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Sunset Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Odina
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,chased 3/8,weakened rail into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Gangster
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met near 5/16,faded rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 21800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CEDAR'S WISH gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the six path on the turn and steadily closed to get up at the wire. JUBA'S HOUSE chased through the backstretch, raced blocked at the heels of the front-runners through the turn, altered course leaving the eighth pole and dug in to a brief lead in late yards, but was nipped under the wire. SISTER JOANN pressured the pace, raced at a close disadvantage four wide on the turn then outfinished in the duel through the stretch. WITNESS THE ENERGY raced with the pace from the three eighths pole, contested at a close disadvantage three wide on the turn then flattened late yards. ARLYNE'S CROWN contested at mostly even terms through the backstretch, took the nod nearing the quarter pole, contested the edge two deep while between horses on the turn but flattened late yards. MANAGED MISCHIEF chased, rounded the turn about the three path, eased out into the lane and finished evenly. SHUTUPN'KISSME broke through the gate and ran off for about a quarter mile, came away sharply and set a brief early pace, but was met leaving the three eighths pole, continued close at the rail on the turn then weakened in the lane. SHENANDOAH CAT gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened. I'M A TOTAL DIVA gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the seven path and weakened in the lane.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Timothy C. Grams & Judith A. Grams

ENTRY.NAME: Arlyne's Crown
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled even terms,nod near 1/4,edge between turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Shutupn'kissme
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke through,ran off,brief early lead,close turn,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 36300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Since March 29 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUSTYS GFIVEFIFTY stalked from the three and four paths on the first turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn two deep, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn, took over later yards and raced clear nearing the wire. RAD PAISLEY took the lead while tapering in and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the half mile pole, dueled close through the backstretch and recovered the advantage at the five sixteenths pole, raced with the edge near the rail on the far turn but was caught later yards and flattened nearing the wire. HERO'S MAN steadied at the rail into the first turn, challenged leaving the half mile pole and dueled with a slim lead, was met at the five sixteenths pole, raced close two deep on the far turn then flattened leaving the sixteenth pole. JACKIE A settled two deep on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn then flattened in the lane. GALLANT GOLD saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. FREEDOM RIDER steadied off the heels of Rustys Gfivefifty into the first turn raced in the five path through the turn, but showed little response down the backstretch. KOZY'S WILDCAT saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Gallant Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Gracie Mae Stables and Great Lake Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Rustys Gfivefifty
ENTRY.OWNER: Bone Robert D and Brown Jr Edward J
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3& 4p,bid near 3/8,2d far turn,up late,clear wire

ENTRY.NAME: Rad Paisley
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured past 1/2,dueled,rail turn,caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IRISH VALENTINE chased outside through the backstretch, raced close in the four path on the turn and dug in under steady handling to get up the final strides. CALERA LOVE rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the quarter pole and rounded the turn at the rail, was steadily handled leaving the turn but was caught in the final strides. ICY STARE exchanged contact with. RAINBOW RHYTHM leaving the gate and engaged in close chase through the backstretch, remained a factor off the rail on the turn but flattened inside the eighth pole. The latter exchanged contact with Icy Stare leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. DEVIN ON EARTH gave close chase inside, raced in range of the leaders at the rail on the turn but weakened leaving the eighth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Devin On Earth
ENTRY.COMMENT: close chase inside,range rail turn,weakened past 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Icy Stare
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,close chase,factor off rail turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Calera Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 1/4,rail turn,caught final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Valentine
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,close 4p turn,dug in lane,up final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 65. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 29 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUCKY BLONDE settled close in the two and three paths on the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, dug in for the lead inside the sixteenth pole and edged clear the final yards. LUCKY BOP stalked through the first turn, challenged three wide nearing the five sixteenths pole, took the lead at the quarter but was met past the sixteenth pole and relented the final yards. JUBA BABY rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure leaving the half mile pole and was met at the seven sixteenths, dueled close at the rail on the far turn but flattened stride nearing mid-stretch. LOVE OF GRACE settled off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. FRENCHIES GOLD was shuffled back early then saved ground well off the pace, eased out with a bid into the backstretch, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. LAUGHINTOTHEBANK rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. KEEP ON SPURRIN raced with the pace two deep, drew to even terms at the seven and dueled from that point, but dropped back between horses midway on the far turn and weakened. NEW AGE BAD GIRL rounded the first turn in the five path and showed little response through the backstretch. ELLIES AT WINDSOR saved ground off the pace, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but faded leaving the five sixteenths.

ENTRY.NAME: Frenchies Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back early,saved ground,chased 1/2,rail turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: New Age Bad Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Krishack Joanne P and Krishack Stephan E

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE gave early chase toward the outside, rounded the turn about the four path, coasted to the lead in late yards and raced clear toward the wire. PINK DINGHY was hustled up outside and set the pace, tapered in and widened at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady handling leaving the turn but was caught flattening stride late yards. HARLEY SIOUX chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. LAST PARTY chased through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn, eased out leaving the turn and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. GOLDEN ARROW became a bit anxious in the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four and five paths and finished evenly to pass rivals. KING OF LUCK gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. B. J. MOOSE ducked in leaving the gate and had a brief early lead, gave chase form the three eighths pole but dropped back at the rail toward the quarter and weakened leaving the turn. MEETMARYSMAN hesitated at the break and saved ground. ONE CANDY CASTLE was shut off at the break, gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the six path. NEEDNOEXPLANATION chased toward the inside, steadied at the rail near the five sixteenths pole and faded through the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: King of Luck
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Kaylee's Spitfire
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,4p turn,coasted to lead late,clear wire

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Mr. & Mrs. Frederick M Clatterbuck Jr.

ENTRY.NAME: B. J. Moose
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in break,briefly lead,chased 3/8,weakened into lane

ENTRY.NAME: Harley Sioux
ENTRY.OWNER: Straughn William E and Thacker Daniel

ENTRY.NAME: Last Party
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Katina M

ENTRY.NAME: Pink Dinghy
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled up,widened rail turn,steady urging lane,caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Its Binn Too Long S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR REGISTERED ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA BRED FILLIES THREE YEAR OLDS. $50 nominations close Wednesday, April 19, 2023. $50 to enter with a purse of $75,000 Added. Entries close Wednesday, April 26, 2023 by the usual time of closing. The added monies and a ll fees to be divided 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weight: 122 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest career earnin gs at the time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIGHTNIN RUNNER angled to the outside to give chase, rounded the turn about the three path, angled to the outside leaving the turn and dug in under steady handling to take the nod at the wire. GREAT SPIRIT contested the pace leaving the half mile pole, dueled clear toward the quarter pole, was steadily encouraged leaving the turn but gave up the nod under the wire. BELLA MELA gave chase through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. MUSIC LASS chased, rounded the turn in the three path, eased out mid-stretch and finished evenly. LA MADDALENA gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. STRYDA contested the pace through the backstretch but dropped back toward the quarter pole and weakened inside the sixteenth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Lightnin Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled out,chased,3p turn,widest 1/8,dug in,nod at wire

ENTRY.NAME: Great Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested pace,clear near 1/4,steady handling,gave up nod wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 29, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Race s Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BONNIE BLUETOOTH came in and made contact with So Red The Rose leaving the gate, rounded the turn about the four path and picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, dueled for the lead three wide leaving the far turn, drew clear toward mid-stretch and held well under steady handling. FLOATING BY settled in the three and four paths on the first turn, bid approaching the three eighths pole, raced in the six path on the far turn and dug in to take second the final yards. ONEPRETTYTHING moved to the inside and rated the pace, dueled leaving the seven sixteenths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn but was met leaving the turn and flattened inside the sixteenth pole. STYLISH PAINT was bumped, jostled and bobbled shortly after the break, raced off the rail on the first turn and gave chase past the half mile pole, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths then flattened in the lane. KIRBY stalked two deep, dueled at even terms from the seven sixteenths pole, raced close between horses on the far turn but flattened toward mid-stretch. SO RED THE ROSE saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. STORMI CAT LADY saved ground and could only improve her position. LIGHTFOOT MISS saved ground well off the pace on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. SEEDS OF TIME was bumped early and raced well off the pace on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. MISS WILD ducked sharply outward leaving the gate, was never a factor and her rider lost an iron somewhere in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Oneprettything
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,dueled from 7/16,edge rail turn,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Seeds of Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped early,well off pace,off rail,little response

ENTRY.NAME: Stylish Paint
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Wild
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,no factor,lost iron lane
